skillTree.localised_description: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Isha's protection can protect the faithful Asrai through the darkest of days.
Naieth's mortal form seems to shimmer and fade as she links her allies to the prophecies of the stars.
Calling upon the spirits of air, Naieth sends mighty winds howling across the battlefield.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +30

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
Waystalkers’ keen eyes can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and so they demand the same of their troops.
Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

target_if: Flying

skillTree.localised_description: Naieth is always accompanied by her faithful companion Othu the Owl. When not flying around the battlefield Othu rests on Naieth's wrist. Naieth is able to understand the owl's twitterings and knows how to interpret his strange wisdom.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +24%

skillTree.localised_description: Changes in the flow of magic can be detected using the divining rods and used to predict impending danger or the presence of intruders in the forest.

Naieth the Prophetess is skilled in the arcane art of divination. Only a select band of mages know this secret lore. By means of divining rods cut from magical trees they are able to 'feel' the flow of magic deep within the ground.

effects.description: Wych Elm from buildings: +50%(factionwide when on map)
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Lore of Heavens spells
Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Heavens spells

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Naieth has gained quite a following amongst her kindred mages. Spellsingers from all of Wood Elf realms have joined her host in order to learn her ancient arcane ways.

effects.description:
Spellweaver Lords can cast additional spells from their lores without unlocking them
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Naieth has become so adept at interpreting changes in the flow of magic that she is know throughout Loren as The Prophetess.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Comet of Casandora"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Comet of Casandora Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Comet of Casandora Upgraded"

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Chain Lightning"

skillTree.localised_description: A strong mind is needed to channel the Winds of Magic. Those that have such a gift become arcane conduits - funnelling the magical tempests to their cause.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

skillTree.localised_description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

skillTree.localised_description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Queen of Athel Loren has tasked Naieth to come to Wydrioth, a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lord Findol and Lady Evelyne. Naieth's task is to build a web of magical protection around Athel Loren, so that the Great Forest can be safe from future intruders and invaders. Meanwhile Lord Findol will focus his efforts on hunting orcs, dwarfs, skaven or whatever else he can find from the Pine Crags.

effects.description: Has access to Art of Divination

Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for Spellsinger Heroes
	(all characters)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

items.colour_text: Naieth carries a long rod which is made of the willow twigs of many magical trees woven and entwined tightly together. Wherever this rod is thrust into the ground it has the power to tap the winds of magic and draw it to the surface.
